security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. The skill provides workflow guidance for deployment setup, analytics integration, and environment health checks. All content is declarative documentation - no scripts, no network calls, no command execution.

content.user_title: Set up deployment, analytics, and health monitoring
content.value_statement: This skill automates deployment configuration for Vercel and Netlify, integrates Google Analytics or Vercel Analytics, and diagnoses environment setup. It guides users through deployment workflows without executing arbitrary code.
actual_capabilities: Set up GitHub Actions for automated deployments
Configure Google Analytics or Vercel Analytics tracking
Diagnose missing dependencies and configuration files
limitations: Does not execute deployments - only provides configuration guidance
Does not access external APIs directly
Does not modify production systems without user confirmation
Cannot install packages or run shell commands autonomously

use_cases.title: Deploy web applications
use_cases.description: Configure Vercel or Netlify for Next.js, React, or static sites with automated preview deployments.

use_cases.title: Add analytics tracking
use_cases.description: Set up Google Analytics or Vercel Analytics to track page views, events, and user behavior.

use_cases.title: Diagnose environment issues
use_cases.description: Check for missing tools, invalid configs, and verify deployment readiness before release.

prompt_templates.title: Basic deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy my project to Vercel. Set up automatic deployments and preview URLs for pull requests.

prompt_templates.title: Analytics setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Add Google Analytics 4 to my Next.js project. Configure page view tracking and a conversion event.

prompt_templates.title: Netlify deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up Netlify deployment for my static site. Include environment variables and branch deploys.

prompt_templates.title: Health check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if my environment is ready for deployment. What tools and configs are missing?

output: Step 1: Run `npx vercel` to link project
Step 2: Configure environment variables in Vercel dashboard
Step 3: GitHub Actions will auto-deploy on push to main

best_practices: Review generated configuration files before applying changes
Use environment variables for sensitive credentials, never hardcode them
Test preview deployments before merging to production branch
anti_patterns: Running deployment commands without reviewing the generated config
Skipping environment health checks before production release
Deploying without setting up proper analytics tracking for business metrics

faq.question: What platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: Vercel, Netlify, Google Analytics 4, and Vercel Analytics are fully supported.

faq.question: What are the deployment limits?
faq.answer: This skill generates configurations only. Actual deployment limits depend on your hosting provider plan.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing projects?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill analyzes your project structure and adds configurations without overwriting existing code.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads project files and generates configuration. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if deployment fails?
faq.answer: The health-check sub-skill helps diagnose issues. Common fixes include missing dependencies or incorrect environment variables.

faq.question: How is this different from other deployment tools?
faq.answer: This is a guidance skill, not an execution tool. It provides step-by-step instructions you review before applying.
